page.title: 12LIFE STYLES
page.content: Life in the area in the 1930's was very much based on agriculture, many of the men worked on the land and had little free time from their labours. Special days such as Christmas, Sundays were little different except there was no land work, just caring for the animals. Days out were taken at the market and Cambridge Fair once a year. Holidays were very rare, honeymoon taken in Sheffield. Today however, things are rather different. The working day is much shorter (8.00 a.m. - 5.30 p.m.), they get more holidays and because of the better rates of pay (Â£125 per week), foreign holidays are taken. Days out to the market, Machinery Sales and Big Summer Shows (Royal Show, East of England Show etc) are common. Animals are rare on the farm so more time available.
